Colin, thank you for the idea.  You may indeed be right that a page of
sele=
cted merchandise would work better, that's a good thought.

The whole merch=
andise idea was kind of an experiment, and so far it's
not very successful.=
  But the hypothesis was that people might find it
cool to be able to purch=
ase something that they themselves had a hand
in creating.  I still believe=
 that if done right, there is an element
of truth to that idea.  Perhaps it=
 would be more true with higher-end
type products.  For example, if you evo=
lved your own coffee table
perhaps you'd be more interested in purchasing i=
t than a T-shirt. 
Still, I would think some people would enjoy an evolved =
T-shirt, mug,
stamps, framed picture, etc.  We may try your approach.

ken
=
